title: SF_Guard (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SF_Guard
This function block monitors the relevant safety guard.
There are two independent input parameters for two switches at the safety guard coupled with a time difference (DiscrepancyTime) for closing the guard.

rows:
Guard switch 1 input. FALSE: Guard is not closed. TRUE:
Guard is closed.

Guard switch 2 input. FALSE: Guard is not closed. TRUE:
Guard is closed.

Configures the monitored synchronous time between
S_GuardSwitch1 and S_GuardSwitch2.
Behaviour on error of safety FB

rows.Name: Ready
rows.Comment:
Activation of the FB. TRUE indicates that the FB is
activated and the outputs results are valid, FALSE the FB is
not active and the program is not executed.

rows:
Output indicating that the guard is closed and the guarded
area safe. FALSE: Guard is open. TRUE: both S_GuardSwitches
are TRUE, no error and acknowledgment. Guard is closed.

Output indicating that the FB is active and the primary
safety function is demanded (e.g. related to the safety
functionality).

Output which can be used to signal the operator to press the
reset functionality to continue.
